"A mother prays, Sleep tight, my child, sleep well for I'll be at your side.. that no shadow, no darkness, no tolling bell, shall pierce your dreams this night.‚Äù

Well, every parent wants to keep their children from all harm. It's such a primal thing.

Ant - you are, and will be, an absolute legend and hero - as well as a living saint. I miss you so much already, and I don‚Äôt know who I will turn to in future. Say one for me buddy, you‚Äôve managed to get one step ahead.
I‚Äôm so proud to have called you a dear friend, and I am going to miss you so so much. I‚Äôm heartbroken, and sending all my love, to K√°ren and B.
I loved our drinks and dinners, and last night  I made sure I had a ‚Äúcleanser‚Äù and a ‚Äúnoggin‚Äù of whisky. I hope our good friend has had his usual of ‚Äúpterodactyl wings on toast‚Äù too.
- and I promise we‚Äôll keep the dream alive. Your mark will be indelible in so much of what is to come.

We had so many projects in the pipeline and ideas we were working upon. Your Maltfriscan mission was due to arrive at my school‚Ä¶ Source to Summit would have had your mark. I‚Äôll always remember our dreams and ideas to revolutionise Catholic RE -ARC/Aquinas (we never made a buck!)

I literally cannot imagine who will pick up the baton fighting for better Catholic RE, and wider RE too. Ant had an ability to see into the soul of every single one of us, give us the best advice, at the right time, and make us laugh and smile at every point.
T got B into Thomas the Tank Engine and I will always feel the two of them have a special bond, even if they don‚Äôt know it.

And the way he saved my @JohnCattEd Knowledge Quiz book within a few hours will never ever be forgotten. 

We also talked so much about our impending fatherhood - and the text message telling me ‚Äúit‚Äôs ontological‚Äù was the most important prep I ever got.

With that dataset shared previously - if you don‚Äôt know belief in heaven is basic part of Christianity - then why is is interesting that 1/5th of people calling themselves Christian do not believe in it?

@ThisisRudi @josephkinnaird @LundieEducation Do we? I can‚Äôt think of too many occasions of teaching just beliefs about anything - has always been practices, history, forms of expression, lived reality, philosophy, ethics/morals‚Ä¶ however generally you need a set of general beliefs for much of the rest to make any sense.
@ThisisRudi @josephkinnaird @LundieEducation I think there has to be - with some caveats - or what do we actually teach students?

@ThisisRudi @josephkinnaird @LundieEducation I‚Äôm not convinced that they don‚Äôt? Their challenge is to navigate through this to work out what things can look like at those curriculum / resource levels - being as authentic as possible, recognising provisionality of knowledge and constraints of time.

@josephkinnaird @ThisisRudi @LundieEducation And I know that it can be introduced at any level including primary - but agree the foundations are so key - that are they are studied and fully embedded in memory. Common to get a bit of a mix (up?) of foundation knowledge at every stage - KS3/4/5!

@ThisisRudi @LundieEducation If we deny there are any essentials, basics, key info - even if we know it is contested, nuanced, complex - then I just don‚Äôt know how we really approach things - unless it is just a philosophy/epistemology kind of lesson recognising everything is contested, nuanced and complex?

@ThisisRudi @LundieEducation That‚Äôs not me advocating for low standards - but a pragmatic approach to ensure a minimum level for all. From there, we can build up - if we have specialists, if we have time, if we resources, if we have kids from primary with A* prior knowledge‚Ä¶

@ThisisRudi @LundieEducation ‚Ä¶ the nature of faith/belief in modern Britain or, for eg, KS3 curriculum/lesson content. 

Some will say both.

But they are perhaps not a non-specialist with low ability Year 9 on a wet Wednesday afternoon. 

What is the minimum, essential content they need to deliver?

@ThisisRudi @LundieEducation I don‚Äôt think anyone denies the complexity.
And while we of course want the lived reality of the postmodern world in our classrooms, I still think there are two debates going on here‚Ä¶ I‚Äôm not sure we are all debating the same thing - is it‚Ä¶

@LundieEducation I‚Äôm sure someone will find some Muslims who don‚Äôt / haven‚Äôt‚Ä¶

@JamesHandscombe @michael_merrick @sputniksteve @missdcox Are you using Catholic with a capital letter purely as it is at the start of your tweet? Catholic and catholic are not necessarily interchangeable. The universal church, does not mean the same as the Catholic Church.

@MrMountstevens @michael_merrick @missdcox And you still have Anglo-Catholics, ‚ÄúHigh‚Äù CoE etc. 

In essence, H8th rejected the Pope, which makes it tricky to call yourself Catholic, even if you insist you are.

@MrMountstevens @michael_merrick @missdcox I think this is in part due to the complexity of even today some Anglicans not recognising themselves as Protestants. The English Reformation kept much of the Catholic way of doing things inc bishops, liturgy etc. Therefore it is seen as some kind of middle ground.

@missdcox His actions would certainly align him with other Protestant movements around Europe ie issues with aspects of the Church. In retrospect, it is easy to call him a Protestant, and I‚Äôm comfortable with that, despite it being quite a unique and complex situation!

@missdcox He was excommunicated, which means he was deprived of all sacraments (except Penance), so not a practising Catholic. You are Catholic by baptism though - so he was technically a Catholic, but hard to argue he was Catholic in any other sense.
@missdcox Isn‚Äôt the phrase used in the Act of Supremacy? I think he certainly fits the definition of Protestant, in so far as he didn‚Äôt agree with the Church.

However there was something so unique and distinct and wonderful and joyful about Meatloaf. 

He is on the ‚Äúwish I‚Äôd seen live list‚Äù. I‚Äôve seen live videos and there is no doubt that he was one of a kind. And also on the ‚Äúthey don‚Äôt make them like that anymore‚Äù.

A few years back - fighting the ‚Äúplaylist culture‚Äù - I put on ‚ÄúBat Out of Hell‚Äù in its entirety. I was exhausted, and exhilarated. I realised it was that same adventure of Born to Run and realised that actually Meatloaf shared some of that cinematic drama of Bruce.

I remember the amazing videos on the Saturday chart show and thinking ‚ÄúWow this dude!‚Äù. As an early teen getting the Very Best of on CD. It was hit after hit - but aware of a slight snobbery about his music - I didn‚Äôt care too much. I also then got obsessed by Fight Club‚Ä¶

Why did I do this thread? To help you keep an eye on ‚Äúunconventional‚Äù symptoms, encourage you to test (I know most people would not have bothered with the second PCR), and keep taking care - esp in schools. It ain‚Äôt gone yet. https://t.co/u1Vh788rzt

Another symptom - for around 4 days it felt like I had my 3yo sitting on my chest. All the time. I was trying to take care of him (as we tried to separate and socially distance in the house) and sometimes he would actually sit on my chest. That felt like 2 3yos on my chest!
Oh - I also got a massive great big rash on my chin early on! That was so sore and itchy. No one ever warned about that!

I‚Äôve seen quite a lot of teachers testing positive recently - I hope you have milder symptoms than me! 

Please do take care all. I wouldn‚Äôt wish this on anyone. 

BTW - My 3yo seems fully recovered and  no long covid! Took my 5yo a good few months last Dec to fully recover.

I‚Äôve also found it has caused anxiety, ‚Äúfever dreams‚Äù (despite not having fever!) and unexplained lows. 

I think I really underestimated what the virus could do to me. I‚Äôm someone who has been careful and still wears a mask more than many others.

I‚Äôm double jabbed, reasonably fit and healthy - however on Day 13 since symptoms began - there is a way to go. I walked about 2miles yesterday to pick up kids. Today my ankles and legs feel like I have run 20+ miles.

This lasted until the following Monday. The exhaustion continued - I‚Äôve never experienced anything like it before and I‚Äôve spent remainder of the week doing a bit of work and then having to lie down. I‚Äôm still not right and feels like I‚Äôm a long way off my usual fitness regime

By Wednesday evening, I wasn‚Äôt well at all and just lying on the sofa. Main symptoms were runny nose - a literal tap, lots of sneezing, headaches inc ‚Äúfoggy‚Äù and confusion, pressure behind eyes - general aches and stiffness - and non stop waves of tiredness and exhaustion

Spent the last two weeks looking last this‚Ä¶ started with my 3yo testing positive on our Sunday LFTs. He then got a positive on PCR, I didn‚Äôt. I did have what I thought was a cold.
